intro: Physaria hitchcockii var. rubicundula, commonly known as the red-stemmed bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are typically reddish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
